author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! âœ…

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Thanks for submitting your package! For the `CamelCase` that is the norm for Julia packages, I think it would be expected for acronyms to remain in all-caps. So that would be `VPINEstimatation`, in this case. Would you consider [renaming the package](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name) accordingly?

Thanks for your feedback! I agree that following the CamelCase convention with acronyms in all-caps is the right approach. I'll rename the package from VpinEstimation to VPINEstimation to align with Julia package naming standards. 

Please close this PR and I will submit a new registration request for VPINEstimation.jl with the updated name.

body:
- Registering package: VpinEstimation
- Repository: https://github.com/jinyunfan/VpinEstimation.jl
- Created by: @jinyunfan
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: d8811dd8dd7a1ad8a0bd2d759f75cbf163496b0a
- Reviewed by: @jinyunfan
- Reference: https://github.com/jinyunfan/VpinEstimation.jl/issues/6#issuecomment-3437923909
- Description: With reference to Easley et al(2014), the volume synchronized probability of informed trading is estimated under high-frequency environment, and the index VPIN(volume synchronized probability of informed trading) is calculated.
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
`````
## v0.1.0 - Initial Release

First release of VpinEstimation.jl for calculating Volume-synchronized Probability of Informed Trading (VPIN) from high-frequency trading data.

### Key Features
- VPIN calculation algorithm implementation
- High-frequency data processing capabilities  
- Comprehensive input validation
- Performance optimized for Julia
- Complete documentation and examples

### Usage
```julia
using VpinEstimation
daily_vpin, bucket_data = vpin(60, 50, 10, trading_data)
`````
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->

<!--  -->
title: New package: VpinEstimation v0.1.0
